meanings.definition: The act of making more promises or obligations than one can realistically fulfill.
meanings.sent1: Her overcommitments to various clubs and sports left her with no free time.
meanings.sent2: His overcommitments at work led to burnout and stress.
meanings.sent3: Despite his overcommitments, he still managed to juggle all his responsibilities.
meanings.sent4: Her overcommitments weighed her down like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The pile of overcommitments on her desk seemed never-ending.

meanings.definition: A situation in which one has committed to too many tasks or responsibilities.
meanings.sent1: The student's overcommitments to extracurricular activities affected his grades.
meanings.sent2: Managing multiple projects simultaneously often leads to overcommitments.
meanings.sent3: His overcommitments turned his schedule into a chaotic mess.
meanings.sent4: The weight of her overcommitments felt like a mountain on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: Trying to balance all his overcommitments was like walking a tightrope.
